text: Just throwing this out there to share with this community.  I created a proof of concept site that allows me to take the content from a wordpress page (inside the <article></article> tags).  The current site I have uploaded takes three urls of wordpress sites I found / knew of and creates HubSpot Pages in the HS demo site.  Once the three pages load and do some explaining of what is going on and debugging so you can see how it works, it provides a form so you can paste in another wordpress page url to see how it work on that page

I haven't done some personal time programming in a while and figured I'd test this out before I get into blog migration.  If you have any questions, let me know. I'd also love your feedback if you have any

The project is done in PHP and uses composer to bring in two packages to do provide nice debugging as well as a CURL wrapper to make my code cleaner without having to reinvent the wheel when using the HubSpot API
